discussion.p:
The declaration of the overload of basic_regex<>::assign(const charT* p, size_t len, flag_type f) has an inconsistent default argument for the flag_type f parameter.
p3:

blockquote.pre: basic_regex& assign(const charT* p, size_t len, flag_type f);
basic_regex& assign(const charT* ptr, size_t len, flag_type f = regex_constants::ECMAScript);

discussion.p:
Since all other overloads have a default argument in both and I propose to add a default argument for this overload in the declaration in .
It should be pointed out that there exists implementation divergence due to the current wording state: At least one implementation (libc++) implements the assignment without a default argument.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4830.

li.p: Modify , class template basic_regex synopsis, as indicated:
